page.title: 11Caldwell Church MA
page.content: Caldwell church was built in{1844}and was paid for by Charlotte Catherine Ann{Countess of Bridgewater.}It is built of sandstone and slate and there are two bells. The church is quite small and an ordinary rectangular shape. The church is not dedicated to any saint. It is only licensed for christenings and funerals. The average size of the{congregation}is six. Most of the congregation is middle-aged. The number of people on the electoral roll is five. The average{collection} is five pounds. Fund-raising events are with Forcett church. It does not have an organ but it has a harmonium. The heating is electric. The{services} are held twice a month. The church shares a{vicar}with Forcett, Stanwick, East Layton and Aldbrough parishes. The vicar retired in January and has not been replaced yet.
